descriptors.label: Platform - SLSTK3400A EFM32HG ACMP Interrupt
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates a simple comparison of 2 inputs. An external input pin is compared with internal Vref of 1.25V. The program interrupts when the voltage on that pin drops below 1.25V, and toggles LED0.

descriptors.label: Platform - SLSTK3400A EFM32HG ACMP Pin Output
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates a simple comparison of 2 inputs. An external input pin is compared with an internal Vref of 1.25V. When the voltage on the input pin is above 1.25V, an output pin will be set high. When it is low, the output pin will be set low.

descriptors.description: This project demonstrates a simple comparison of 2 inputs. An input pin is one input, which is compared with internal Vref of 1.25V. The program polls for a voltage greater than 1.25V on this input pin (see below for which pin).

descriptors.label: Platform - SLSTK3400A EFM32HG DMA Single Button
descriptors.description: In this example, the DMA transfers 128 halfwords (256 bytes) from one software array to another. The transfer is requested by a button press on Push Button 1 routed through the PRS. A Callback Function is called when the tranfer is complete.

descriptors.label: Platform - SLSTK3400A EFM32HG EM4 Wakeup
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the ability for a pin to wake the device from EM4. Under a normal, non-EM4 reset, the device will enter EM4. Pressing PB0 will wake the device from EM4 and cause the LEDs on the STK to toggle indefinitely.

descriptors.description: This project demonstrates a simple polled-mode use of the device's GPIOs. Pushbuttons 0 and 1 are constantly polled. If pressed, LED0 and LED1, respectively, are turned on.

descriptors.label: Platform - SLSTK3400A EFM32HG IDAC TIMER DMA Waveform
descriptors.description: This example shows how to use a timer and the DMA to output a sinewave using the IDAC. This project operates in EM1.

descriptors.label: Platform - STK3200 EFM32ZG IDAC TIMER DMA Waveform
descriptors.description: This example shows how to use a timer and the DMA to output a sinewave using the IDAC. This project operates in EM1.

descriptors.label: Platform - SLSTK3400A EFM32HG IDAC TIMER PRS
descriptors.description: This example shows how to use a timer to control the IDAC through the PRS. The IDAC is configured to enable its output based on the signal it receives from PRS channel 0. The timer generates a square waveform signal that it sends to the PRS. This project operates in ...

descriptors.label: Platform - STK3300 EFM32TG One Shot Output Compare
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates output compare in EM2 using the LETIMER. The project initializes the timer in one-shot mode, and after one second, while staying in a low energy mode, will set either an Exp Header Pin or LED0 high.

descriptors.label: Platform - STK3600 EFM32LG One Shot Output Compare

descriptors.label: Platform - STK3300 EFM32TG Pulse Train
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates pulse train generation using the LETIMER. The project initializes the timer in free mode, and creates a one LFCLK length pulse on each underflow event. The underflow occurs at 1 kHz frequency.

descriptors.label: Platform - STK3600 EFM32LG Pulse Train

descriptors.label: Platform - STK3300 EFM32TG Pulse Width Modulation
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates pulse width modulation using the LETIMER. The project initializes the timer for PWM with a set 30 percent duty cycle at 1 Hz frequency. The waveform is output on either an Expansion Header Pin or LED0 depending on the board.

descriptors.label: Platform - SLSTK3400A EFM32HG LEUART DMA
descriptors.description: This example uses the LEUART to receive serial input and then echo it back using the DMA/LDMA (Linked DMA is for series 1 devices only). The devices stays in EM2 the entire time since the DMA/LDMA module can still operate in EM2.

descriptors.label: Platform - SLSTK3400A EFM32HG Async Interrupt
descriptors.description: This example echoes back lines sent to it over the virtual com port by the user using a baudrate of 115200. Once a new line or 80 characters are received, the RxBuffer is echoed back.

descriptors.label: Platform - SLSTK3400A EFM32HG SPI Master DMA

descriptors.description: This project demonstrates a simple comparison of 2 inputs. An external input pin is compared with an internal Vref of 1.25V. When the voltage on the input pin is above 1.25V, an output pin will be set high. When it is low, the output pin will be set low.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P ADC Scan Diff Interrupt
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates using the ADC0 peripheral to take differential-ended analog measurements across different channels. ADC interrupts handle completed conversions and stores them in a software array.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1 HFRCO CAL Interrupt
descriptors.description: The device is initialized for the board it is running on, and the qualified HFRCO is output to a pin where it can be observed. The CRYOTIMER is setup to generate an interrupt every 16 seconds, and the device enters EM1 (so that the clock output remains active).

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P DSP LIB FFT
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates performing windowing and FFT on a time domain signal using the ARM CMSIS DSP_lib. A test 10kHz cosine is used for time domain data. The signal is first windowed by a hamming window function. This prevents artifacts in the FFT caused by disco...

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P CRYOTIMER ULFRCO EM123
descriptors.description: This project shows how to use the Cryotimer with the ULFRCO in EM3. The project idles in EM3 while waiting for the interrupt handler to toggle LED0. An interrupt occurs every 2048 ULFRCO clock cycles (about 2.05 seconds) by default.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P CRYOTIMER ULFRCO RET EM4EXIT
descriptors.description: This project shows how to use the Cryotimer in EM4 with the ULFRCO and GPIO retention where the retention is enabled upon entering EM4 and disabled upon exiting EM4. This project shows the program execution by using LEDs.

descriptors.label: Platform - SLSTK3402A EFM32PG12B CRYOTIMER Wakeup MSC Erase
descriptors.description: This project shows how to use the Cryotimer with the ULFRCO to wake up from EM4. This project also shows how to write/erase the USERDATA page. Results of this project are shown using LEDs.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4103A EFR32BG12P Voltage Scaling
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the Voltage Scaling capabilities of the EMU. When PB0 is pressed, the handler switches between VSCALE0 and VSCALE2. Using the energy profiler, you can then observe the differences is current draw between these two voltage scaling values.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P GPCRC DMA
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the GPCRC used to check 32-bit data using the IEEE 802.3 polynomial standard in EM1. Data is fed into the GPCRC via the LDMA. The size of the data array being fed into LDMA and GPCRC can be increased depending on the application. The examp...

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P EM4 Wakeup
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the ability for a pin to wake the device from EM4. Under a normal, non-EM4 reset, the device will enter EM4. Pressing PB1 will wake the device from EM4 and cause the LEDs on the STK to toggle indefinitely. Note for GG11 and TG11, PB1 is mapp...

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P I2C
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates both master and slave configurations of the EFM32 I2C peripheral. Two EFM32 starter kits are connected via a single I2C bus, and each EFM32 I2C peripheral is setup to both transmit (master mode) and receive (slave mode).

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P LDMA Linked List
descriptors.description: Software requests an LDMA transfer on a linked list of 4 descriptors, which each move 32 halfwords of memory into a destination buffer. There are interrupts triggered after the second and fourth descriptors.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P LDMA Ping Pong
descriptors.description: Software requests LDMA ping-pong transfers. A universal source array is transfered first to the "pingBuffer" array, then to the "pongBuffer", then back to ping, etc. After each transfer, there is an interrupt that increments the elements of the source buffer, then...

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P LDMA Scatter Gather
descriptors.description: Software requests an LDMA transfer on a linked list of 4 descriptors to "scatter" one large array into 4 smaller arrays. Each descriptor moves 8 halfwords of memory into a destination buffer. An interrupt triggers after the completion of the "scatter".

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P One Shot Output Compare
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates output compare in EM2 using the LETIMER. The project initializes the timer in one-shot mode, and after one second, while staying in a low energy mode, will set either an Exp Header Pin or LED0 high.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P Pulse Train
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates pulse train generation using the LETIMER. The project initializes the timer in free mode, and creates a one LFCLK length pulse on each underflow event. The underflow occurs at 1 kHz frequency.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P Pulse Width Modulation
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates pulse width modulation using the LETIMER. The project initializes the timer for PWM with a set 30 percent duty cycle at 1 Hz frequency. The waveform is output on either an Expansion Header Pin or LED0 depending on the board.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4103A EFR32BG12P Pulse Width Modulation
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates pulse width modulation using the LETIMER. The project initializes the timer for PWM with a set 30 percent duty cycle at 1 Hz frequency. The waveform is output on either an Expansion Header Pin or LED0 depending on the board.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P LEUART DMA
descriptors.description: This example uses the LEUART to receive serial input and then echo it back using the DMA/LDMA (Linked DMA is for series 1 devices only). The devices stays in EM2 the entire time since the DMA/LDMA module can still operate in EM2.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P MSC RW
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the use of the userdata page of the flash memory. The value 32 is stored in the 4th word of the page. A variable is set to the value stored at this location, which can then be read in the debugger

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P RTCC Alarm Set
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the RTCC peripheral by setting an alarm. Information is sent to and from the device via the device's USART and the STK's VCOM port. After the current date/time and the alarm date/time are set, LED1 will turn on when the alarm occurs.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P TIMER DMA Edge Capture
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates edge capture with DMA. The first 512 events captured by TIMER1 CC0 are transferred to a fixed length buffer by the DMA. This project captures falling edges of an external input periodic signal.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P Async Interrupt
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates interrupt-drive operation of the USART in asynchronous mode. Depending on the device, USART0, USART1, or USART4 is configured for asynchronous operation at 115200 baud with 8 data bits, no parity, and one stop bit (115200N81). The main loo...

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P Async Polled
descriptors.description: This example echoes back lines sent to it over the virtual com port by the user using a baudrate of 115200. Once a new line or 80 characters are received, the RxBuffer is echoed back.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P SPI Master DMA
descriptors.description: This example demonstrates using DMA with SPI as the master. 10 bytes, 0x00 - 0x09, are transmitted on MOSI. 10 bytes are received on MISO. Expected values are 0xA0 - 0xA9.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4103A EFR32BG12P VDAC TIMER DMA Waveform
descriptors.description: This project uses the DAC/VDAC and TIMER0 to output a 32 point sine wave at a particular frequency (10 kHz by default). This project operates in EM1 because the timer can't operate in EM2/EM3.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P EMU VMON EM4 Wakeup
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates using the VMON to wakeup from EM4H whenever the battery level drops below a certain threashold. When first loaded, LED0 will be set to off. Once the voltage drops below THRESHOLD_VOLTAGE (3.0 V), LED0 is turned on.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4100A EFR32BG1P EMU VMON Interrupt
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the VMON to detect battery level threasholds in EM2. When the source battery is below the THRESHOLD_VOLTAGE (3.0 V), LED0 is off. When the battery is above THRESHOLD_VOLTAGE, LED0 is on. Interrupts occur on rising and falling edges to re-e...

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4103A EFR32BG12P WTIMER DMA Edge Capture
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates edge capture with DMA. The first 512 events captured by WTIMER CC0 are transferred to a fixed length buffer by the LDMA. This project captures falling edges of an external input periodic signal.

descriptors.description: The device is initialized for the board it is running on, and the qualified LFRCO is output to a pin where it can be observed. The calibration mechanism is setup, and a calibration run is started.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4180A EFR32MG21 LFRCO CAL Polled
descriptors.description: The device is initialized for the board it is running on, and the qualified LFRCO is output to a pin where it can be observed. The BURTC is setup to generate an interrupt every 16 seconds, and the device enters EM1 (so that the clock output remains active).

descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the usage of LESENSE to sample two channels using ACMP. The LESENSE uses the ACMP peripheral to sample the input state of push button 0 and 1. The dedicated LESENSE decoder is used to read the sensor state and update its internal state mac...

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4204D EFR32ZG23 LESENSE Single Channel
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the usage of LESENSE to sample a single channel using ACMP. The LESENSE uses the ACMP peripheral to sample the input state of push button 0, and will trigger an interrupt to toggle LED0 when push button 0 is pressed.

descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the usage of LESENSE to sample a single channel using ACMP. The LESENSE uses the ACMP peripheral to sample the input state of push button 0, and will trigger an interrupt to toggle LED0 when push button 0 is pressed.

descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the usage of LESENSE to sample a single channel using ACMP. The LESENSE uses the ACMP peripheral to sample the input state of push button 0, and will trigger an interrupt to toggle LED0 when push button 0 is pressed.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4181A EFR32MG21 One Shot Output Compare
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates output compare in EM2 using the LETIMER. The project initializes the letimer in one-shot mode, and expansion header pin toggles REPEAT_COUNT times while staying in a low energy mode.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4181A EFR32MG21 Pulse Train
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates pulse train generation using the LETIMER. The project initializes the letimer in free mode, and creates a one LFCLK length pulse on each underflow event. The underflow occurs at 1 kHz frequency.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4181A EFR32MG21 Pulse Width Modulation
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates pulse width modulation using the LETIMER. The project initializes the letimer for PWM with a set 30 percent duty cycle at 1 Hz frequency. The waveform is output on an Expansion Header Pin on the board.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4181A EFR32MG21 MSC RW
descriptors.description: This project demonstrates the use of the userdata page of the flash memory. The value 32 is stored in the 4th word of the page. A variable is set to the value stored at this location, which can then be read in the debugger.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4186C EFR32MG24 VDAC Sine Wave Synch
descriptors.description: This project uses the VDAC and the internal sine wave generator to produce a 16-point sine wave at a frequency of f_sinewave Hz centered at the reference voltage divided by 2. This project operates in EM1. By default, this program outputs a sinewave at 31.25 kHz.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4186C EFR32MG24 VDAC TIMER DMA Waveform
descriptors.description: This project uses the DAC/VDAC and TIMER0 to output a 32 point sine wave at a particular frequency (10 kHz by default). The project uses the LDMA to write to the CH0F buffer. This project operates in EM1 because the timer can't operate in EM2/EM3.

descriptors.label: Platform - BRD4204D EFR32ZG23 VDAC TIMER DMA Waveform
descriptors.description: This project uses the DAC/VDAC and TIMER0 to output a 32 point sine wave at a particular frequency (10 kHz by default). The project uses the LDMA to write to the CH0F buffer. This project operates in EM1 because the timer can't operate in EM2/EM3.
